intro: Corydalis retingensis, commonly known as the Tibetan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to the harsh climatic conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branched. Corydalis retingensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique floral display.
